metadata.title: ICE-Related Court Cases, Lawsuits, and Legal Challenges 2025-2026
metadata.description: Comprehensive documentation of federal court rulings, civil rights lawsuits, constitutional violations, and injunctions related to ICE operations

federal_court_rulings.case_name: Castañon Nava v. Department of Homeland Security
federal_court_rulings.court: U.S. District Court, Northern District of Illinois
federal_court_rulings.jurisdiction: Chicago Area of Responsibility (IL, IN, WI, KS, KY, MO)
key_findings: ICE violated 2022 consent decree by conducting at least 22 warrantless arrests in early 2025
ICE agents regularly carried blank warrants and filled them out only after detaining someone
Consent decree extended 118 days until February 2, 2026
Court ordered release of 13 individuals detained unlawfully
Court ordered release of up to 615 additional people on $1,500 bond by November 21, 2025
constitutional_violations: Fourth Amendment - Unreasonable search and seizure

federal_court_rulings.case_name: Vasquez Perdomo v. Noem (Los Angeles Raids)
federal_court_rulings.court: U.S. District Court, Central District of California
key_findings: Federal court found ICE likely violated Fifth Amendment by denying detained immigrants lawful access to attorneys
B-18 detention facility in downtown Los Angeles used to detain people for days in conditions preventing meaningful communication with counsel
Detainees denied phone access, turned away from in-person meetings, pressured to sign documents without legal advice
Pregnant women, elderly adults, and minors detained without access to medication or hygiene supplies
constitutional_violations: Fifth Amendment - Denial of due process and access to counsel
Fourth Amendment claims (TRO later dissolved on standing grounds)
injunction_requirements: Seven-day attorney access at B-18 facility
Confidential in-person and telephone communications at no cost
Prompt notice and alternatives if B-18 is closed

supreme_court_involvement.outcome: Supreme Court stayed district court's July 11 injunction pending appeal (6-3)
supreme_court_involvement.kavanaugh_concurrence: Wrote that 'apparent ethnicity' could be used as 'relevant factor' in determining reasonable suspicion when combined with other factors

federal_court_rulings.status: Active - Fifth Amendment injunction in place; Fourth Amendment TRO dissolved
plaintiffs_counsel: UC Irvine School of Law Immigrant and Racial Justice Solidarity Clinic

federal_court_rulings.case_name: Minnesota v. Department of Homeland Security (Operation Metro Surge)
federal_court_rulings.court: U.S. District Court, District of Minnesota
key_findings: Preliminary injunction barred ICE agents from using pepper spray, arresting, detaining, or retaliating against peaceful protesters
Banned agents from stopping and arresting drivers who are not 'forcibly obstructing or interfering'
Injunction applied only to Operation Metro Surge agents in Minnesota
constitutional_violations_alleged: First Amendment - Targeting Minnesota based on political viewpoints
Tenth Amendment - Federal commandeering of state police resources

appeals_court_action.outcome: Blocked preliminary injunction while weighing longer-term stay

related_incident.name: Renee Nicole Good shooting
related_incident.description: 37-year-old U.S. citizen and mother of three shot and killed by ICE agent Jonathan Ross while sitting in her vehicle

plaintiffs: State of Minnesota (Attorney General Keith Ellison)

aclu_and_civil_rights_lawsuits.court: U.S. District Court, District of Minnesota
key_allegations: ICE and CBP suspicionless stops targeting Somali and Latino communities
Warrantless arrests without probable cause
Racial profiling under Operation Metro Surge
constitutional_violations_alleged: Fourth Amendment - Unreasonable search and seizure

named_plaintiffs.name: Mubashir Khalif Hussen
named_plaintiffs.incident_description: Stopped by masked ICE agents while walking to lunch. Despite repeatedly stating 'I'm a citizen,' agents refused to look at his ID, placed him in an SUV, shackled and fingerprinted him before release.

aclu_and_civil_rights_lawsuits.court: U.S. District Court, District of Minnesota
key_allegations: ICE agents routinely violating constitutional rights of protesters and observers
Arresting and retaliating against people protesting ICE
Detaining protesters without probable cause
Using law enforcement databases to scan license plates and retrieve observers' home addresses
At least one observer was followed by ICE to her home
constitutional_violations_alleged: First Amendment - Retaliation against protected speech and assembly
Fourth Amendment - Detention without probable cause

aclu_and_civil_rights_lawsuits.case_name: Gomez Ruiz, et al. v. ICE (Detention Conditions)
aclu_and_civil_rights_lawsuits.court: U.S. District Court, Northern District of California
aclu_and_civil_rights_lawsuits.facility_details: Privately owned, California's largest immigration detention center
key_allegations: Inhumane conditions at California's largest immigration detention center
Violations of detainee rights

aclu_and_civil_rights_lawsuits.court: U.S. District Court, District of Columbia
key_allegations: Unlawful arrests of immigrants at immigration court hearings
Collusion between DHS and DOJ to strip due process rights
ICE requesting case dismissals, then arresting individuals upon dismissal
Fast-track deportations without proper legal proceedings
aclu_and_civil_rights_lawsuits.class_definition: All noncitizens arrested at or near immigration courthouses on the day of their hearing on or after January 21, 2025
plaintiffs_counsel: Lawyers' Committee for Civil Rights of the San Francisco Bay Area

key_allegations: Widespread denial of bond hearings to ICE detainees
Systematic misclassification of people arrested inside the U.S.
Reclassifying detainees from 8 U.S.C. § 1226 (allows bond) to 8 U.S.C. § 1225 (no-bond detention)

prior_ruling.court: U.S. District Court, Western District of Washington
prior_ruling.outcome: Ruled the practice was likely illegal and ordered bond hearing for wrongfully detained litigant

key_allegations: ICE sensitive locations policy rescission violates religious freedoms
Armed government agents at worship houses disrupts free association and worship
Policy change was arbitrary and capricious
legal_arguments: First Amendment - Freedom of religion and assembly
plaintiffs_counsel: Institute for Constitutional Advocacy and Protection

key_allegations: New ICE policy allowing enforcement at schools violates APA
Policy change was arbitrary and capricious

sensitive_locations_policy_lawsuits.outcome: Dismissed - Judge ruled churches could not show sufficient harm to establish standing
sensitive_locations_policy_lawsuits.reasoning: Claims about church attendance fears or harassment by immigration officers were too speculative
sensitive_locations_policy_lawsuits.note: Over 1,400 churches protected under separate federal injunction in Maryland

circumstances: ICE initially stated he died after staff 'observed him in distress'
Witness testimony indicates guards choked him to death
Private guard 911 call indicates struggle after alleged suicide attempt
Man was handcuffed and stopped breathing during subsequent struggle
Found dead after only 4 days in custody
Reportedly found with hands and feet tied behind him
Mother of three shot while sitting in her SUV
Had reportedly just dropped off her six-year-old child at school
Was acting as legal observer during Operation Metro Surge protests
Video shows agent fired three shots as Good began to drive away
detention_deaths_and_wrongful_death_case.investigation_status: FBI leading investigation; Minnesota officials contesting federal-only investigation
related_lawsuits: Minnesota v. DHS (Operation Metro Surge lawsuit)

notes: 2025 had the highest number of deaths since 2004
December 2025 was the deadliest month on record
If current pace continues, 2026 could see 80+ deaths (more than double previous record)
Over 65,000 people currently in ICE custody (two-thirds increase since Trump took office)

damages_and_settlements.case_name: NYC Department of Correction ICE Detainer Settlement
damages_and_settlements.class_definition: Individuals detained by NYC DOC beyond their scheduled release date based solely on ICE detainers

damages_and_settlements.facts: U.S. citizen detained for seven days by ICE in solitary confinement despite having his citizenship
U.S. citizen assaulted and unlawfully detained by federal immigration officers in front of a Home Depot in Los Angeles
plaintiffs_counsel: MALDEF (Mexican American Legal Defense and Educational Fund)

key_requirements: PERC cannot use detainer forms without neutral review process
Procedural protections comparable to Fourth Amendment required
damages_and_settlements.individual_remedies: Detainees arrested in violation may seek immediate release from detention

pending_claims_overview.note: Despite tens of billions in claims, ICE paid less than $1 million in settlements as of 2023

foia_and_transparency_lawsuits.records_sought: ICE plans to expand immigration detention across Virginia
foia_and_transparency_lawsuits.trigger: ICE Requests for Information issued May 28, 2025 seeking 'available detention facilities'

foia_and_transparency_lawsuits.records_sought: ICE plans to expand immigration detention across Colorado and Wyoming
foia_and_transparency_lawsuits.trigger: ICE solicitations issued February 14, 2025 seeking contract proposals for detention facilities

foia_and_transparency_lawsuits.records_sought: Guidance for arresting noncitizens in immigration court
foia_and_transparency_lawsuits.context: Since May 20, 2025, ICE has been detaining noncitizens in immigration courts when they appear for removal hearings

legal_challenges: Hussen v. Noem (ACLU racial profiling class action)
constitutional_issues_raised: First Amendment - Targeting based on political viewpoints
Fourth Amendment - Warrantless arrests, unreasonable seizures
Tenth Amendment - Federal commandeering of state resources
